title: Mathematics Education Innovation Project Through Organizational Learning and Unlearning

context.prior_knowledge: Core mathematics education theory and understanding of elementary mathematics curricula
context.additional_context: A course where current elementary mathematics educators analyze organizational-level learning/unlearning strategies and explore methods for applying them in educational settings. Operated with a focus on digital tool-based project execution and summative evaluation

learning_goals: Core concepts of organizational learning theory (first/second-order learning, single/double-loop learning) can be accurately linked to mathematical education contexts
Cognitive barriers in mathematical education settings can be analyzed, and three or more unlearning strategies to address them can be designed
A dynamic learning-unlearning process can be experienced through PBL, and a concrete action plan to innovate existing educational practices can be established

resources: Instructional materials on organizational learning theory
Digital collaboration tools (Google Workspace, Miro, etc.)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
